Forbes and Walker Tea Brokers
MOST COMPREHENSIVE WEBSITE ON TEA
www.forbestea.com
Page 2
Page 2
COMMENTS
Total auction offerings crossed the 6.0 M/Kgs mark and totalled a 6.45 M/Kgs this week. The highest quantity on offer since Sale No. 5 of 5 February 2025 (6.5 M/Kgs).  Overall, a firm to easier trend in prices with the liquoring Small Leaf teas discounted by a higher margin.
Ex-Estate offerings increased to 0.95 M/Kgs. Overall quality was mostly lower to last.
Best Western BOP/BOPF's - Select high-priced teas declined by Rs. 100 per kg and more, whilst the others declined to a lesser extent. In the Below Best category, BOP's were firm and up to Rs. 50 per kg easier, whilst the corresponding BOPF's declined by Rs. 50 per kg and more following quality. At the lower end, BOP's were irregular with some correction in prices observed, whilst the corresponding BOPF's declined by Rs. 50 per kg and more following quality. Nuwara Eliya BOP's were mostly unsold and where sold, declined by up to Rs. 200 per kg. Corresponding BOPF's sold at firm to dearer rates. Uda Pussellawa BOP's were firm and Rs. 20-30 per kg easier, whilst the Uva BOP's declined by up to Rs. 50 per kg. Corresponding BOPF's - Uda Pussellawa's declined by Rs. 50-70 per kg, whilst the Uva's declined by Rs. 20-40 per kg.
High Grown CTC - BP1's had hardly any offerings, whilst the PF1's declined by up to Rs. 50 per kg. Medium Grown CTC's were irregular though reasonable steady, whilst the Low Growns were firm and tended dearer for the PF1's.
Low Growns comprised of 2.6 M/Kgs. All categories met with fair demand.
In the Leafy and Semi-Leafy catalogues, Select Best and Best BOP1's were firm, whilst the balance together with the bolder varieties were irregularly easier. Well-made OP1's were easier, whilst the balance appreciated. A few high-priced OP's were dearer, whilst the balance sold around last levels. Select Best OPA's declined, whilst the balance were firm. However, teas at the bottom appreciated. PEK/PEK1's, in general, were firm.
In the Tippy catalogue, high-priced FBOP's were easier, whilst the Best together with the Below Best varieties were firm. Teas at the bottom appreciated. However, the bolder varieties declined. FF1's, in general, were firm.
In the Premium catalogue, a selection of Very Tippy teas were firm, whilst the Best and cleaner Below Best were firm to easier. The balance declined.
NOTE
Next week's Auction (Sale No. 17) is scheduled for Monday, 05 May and Wednesday, 07 May 2025
World Tea News
FORBES & WALKER TEA BROKERS (PVT) LTD SALE OF - 28TH/ 29TH APRIL 2025
Forbes and Walker Tea Brokers
MOST COMPREHENSIVE WEBSITE ON TEA
www.forbestea.com
Page 3
Page 3
MARKET
Irregular and easier
HIGH GROWN TEAS
BOP
Best Western's - Teas in the higher price bracket declined by Rs. 50-100 per kg, whilst the others were firm and lower to a lesser extent. Tea in the Below Best category were firm and up to Rs. 50 per kg easier. Plainer sorts were irregular. Nuwara Eliya's were mostly unsold and where sold, were up to Rs. 200 per kg easier. Uda Pussellawa's were firm and Rs. 20-30 per kg easier. Uva's - A few select invoices gained by Rs. 100 per kg and more, whilst the others were up to Rs. 50 per kg easier.
BOPF
Best Western's - Select high-priced teas declined by Rs. 100-200 per kg, whilst the others declined by Rs. 50-100 per kg. Teas in the Below Best and Plainer categories declined by Rs. 50 per kg and more following quality. Nuwara Eliya's - A few select invoices sold at firm to dearer rates, whilst the others were difficult of sale. Uda Pussellawa's declined by Rs. 50-70 per kg. Uva's were Rs. 20-40 per kg lower.
OP/OPA
Select Best teas were dearer by Rs. 20-40 per kg. Best and Below Best varieties declined by Rs. 40-60 per kg, whilst the poorer sorts were firm to dearer by Rs. 40 per kg.
PEKOE/PEKOE1
A few flavoury  PEK's were firm, whilst the others were easier by Rs. 40-60 per kg, whilst the Orthodox Leafy PEK's were easier by a similar margin.  Well-made PEK1 types which were firm to dearer by Rs. 30-50 per kg at the commencement of the sale, declined towards the closure by Rs. 50-70 per kg. Below Best and the others were discounted by Rs. 50-80 per kg and more at times. Best Rotovane PEK's gained by Rs. 20-40 per kg on select invoices, whilst the others were firm. Best and Below Best varieties declined by Rs. 50-100 per kg and more at times.
FBOP/FBOPF1
Flavoury FBOP's were firm to irregularly dearer by Rs. 40-60 per kg, whilst the Orthodox Leafy FBOP's were firm. FBOPF1's appreciated by Rs. 60-80 per kg and more at times, whilst the teas at the lower end were dearer by Rs. 40-60 per kg.

MEDIUM GROWN TEAS

Large Leaf teas sold well at firm to dearer rates, whilst the others were irregular.
BOPF

OP/OPA
Well-made OP/OPA's were firm to easier by Rs. 20-40 per kg, whilst the Below Best and the others were dearer by Rs. 40-60 per kg.
PEKOE/PEKOE1
PEK's were firm to easier by Rs. 40-60 per kg. Best and Below Best varieties were lower by Rs. 40-60 per kg, whilst the others and poorer sorts declined by Rs. 50-80 per kg.
FBOP/FBOPF1
Select Best FBOP's held firm, whilst the Best varieties were dearer by Rs. 50-70 per kg. Below Best types were firm to easier by Rs. 40-60 per kg. Better FF1's gained substantially, whilst the others appreciated by Rs. 50-70 per kg and more at times. Teas at the lower end were firm to dearer by Rs. 30-50 per kg.

OFF GRADES
FGS1/FGS
Teas in the Best category were lower to last by Rs. 20-40 per kg. Below Best varieties which were easier by Rs. 20-40 per kg at the commencement of the sale, declined further towards the latter part with certain invoices being unsellable at times.
Teas at the lower end of the market declined by Rs. 30-50 per kg. Low Growns - Clean Tea varieties were firm on last, whilst the balance were dearer by Rs. 20-40 per kg. CTC - Clean leaf varieties were firm to dearer, whilst the balance maintained.
BROKENS
In general, were firm to dearer.
BOP1A
Main Grade reducer  varieties in the Best category together with the balance maintained around last week's levels. Below Best sorts were dearer by Rs. 20 per kg and more on occasion, whilst the poorer sorts gained by Rs. 20-30 per kg.

Best High and Mid Grown CTC teas were lower by Rs. 40-60 per kg, whilst the Below Best varieties together with the poorer sorts followed a similar trend. Best Low Grown CTC teas were firm, whilst the others declined by Rs. 40-50 per kg.
DUST
Clean leaf secondaries were easier by Rs. 40-60 per kg, whilst the poorer sorts were dearer by Rs. 30-40 per kg. Low Grown varieties declined by Rs. 30-40 per kg.

CROP AND WEATHER
For
the
period
22
-
2
8
April
2025
Western/Nuwara
Eliya
Regions
The Nuwara Eliya and Western regions reported bright mornings and evening showers. According to the Department of Meteorology, showers are expected in both regions in the week ahead.
Uva/Uda Pussellawa
Regions
Bright mornings and evening showers were reported throughout the week in both regions. Heavy showers are expected in the Uda Pussellawa and Uva regions according to the Department of Meteorology.
Low
Growns
Bright mornings and occasional evening showers were reported in the Low Grown Region throughout the week. The Department of Meteorology expects fairly heavy showers in the Low Grown Region in the week ahead.
Crop
Intake
The Nuwara Eliya, Uva, Uda Pussellawa and Western regions reported an increase in the crop intake, whilst the Low Grown Region showed a decrease.

MOMBASA AUCTION
SALE OF - 22ND AND 23RD APRIL 2025 (SALE NO.16)
Good general demand prevailed for the 201,179 packages (13,604,745.00 kilos) on offer; 28.08% remained unsold.
MARKETS
Pakistan Packers, Yemen and other Middle Eastern countries were active at lower levels with improved enquiry from Bazaar. Kazakhstan, other CIS states and Afghanistan maintained support with less interest from Egyptian Packers. UK were steady with some support from Russia. Sudan were absent while South Sudan showed less participation.  Local Packers were less active with Somalia holding support at the lower end of the market.
OFFERINGS
Leaf Grades                -    108,200 packages (7,091,805.00 kilos) - 23.46% unsold.
Dust Grades              -     72,660 packages (5,443,880.00 kilos) - 36.88% unsold.
Secondary Grades      -     20,319 packages (1,069,060.00 kilos) - 21.26% unsold.
LEAF GRADES (M2 & M3)
BP1:
Best - Mostly dearer by up to USC36 but some lines saw easier tendencies and shed up to USC8.
Brighter - Saw irregular absorption and were up to USC47 above previous levels to easier by up to a similar margin.
Mediums - KTDA mediums gained up to USC19 with some invoices USC47 dearer to easier by up to USC10. Plantation mediums appreciated by up to USC21 but some lines lost by up to USC11.
Lower Medium - More but irregular interest at steady to USC17 above previous levels to easier by up to USC12.
Plainer - Were discounted by up to USC16.
PF1:
Best - Irregular and varied between firm to mostly dearer by up to USC26 to easier by up to USC10.
Brighter - Advanced by up to USC10 with select invoices up to USC3 below last levels.
Mediums - KTDA mediums were irregular and ranged between USC13 dearer to easier by up to USC10. Plantation mediums shed up to USC17.
Lower Medium - Mostly easier by up to USC15 but select teas gained by up to USC5.
Plainer - Ranged between USC9 dearer to easier by up to USC12.

Lower Medium - Were irregularly easier by up to USC16.
Plainer - Met good but irregular absorption and ranged between steady to USC11 dearer to easier by up to USC10.
DUST1:

Lower Medium - Lost up to USC7.
Plainer - Steady to USC19 dearer to easier by up to USC9.

BANGLADESH AUCTION
SALE OF - 21ST APRIL 2025 (SALE NO.16)
CTC LEAF: 68,547 packages of tea on offer continued to meet with a selective demand.
BROKENS/FANNINGS: Limited demand continued where once again only a select few lines of teas sold at around last levels with heavier withdrawals.
DUST : 4,331 packages of tea on offer continued to meet with a selective demand. Only a few teas sold around last levels with heavy withdrawals. Blenders lent good support with fair interest from the Loose tea buyers.
C
OMMENTS: This was the last sale of the season (2024- 2025) where the offerings comprised of reprinted teas which again met with a restricted demand. There was a slightly larger weight of New Season teas on offer which met with a stronger demand and witnessed more competition from both Blenders and the Loose tea buyer although prices were below Brokers' valuations. The better varieties ranged between Tk. 240/- and Tk.300/- whilst the Mediums fetched between Tk.210/- and Tk.230/-.
Once again, Dusts saw huge withdrawals.
Our Catalogue: (Sale 49) Avg : Tk 207.79, Sold 20.06% , (Sale 48) Avg : Tk 195.25, Sold 35.63%

KOLKATA SALE  CTC MARKET
MARKET REPORT:
Liquoring Assams meeting with good enquiry and selling at irregularly easier levels.
Plainer Dooars irregularly lower.
BUYING PATTERN:
Western India: Supporting the better teas
HUL : Operating
TCPL: Quiet so far
Exporters : Operating on bolder brokens and fannings
Other Internal/Local:  Fair enquiry
KOLKATA SALE  ORTHODOX MARKET
MARKET REPORT:
Market opened to good demand. Whole leaf irregular and at times tending lower, TGFOP1 selling between Rs 400-440/-, TGFOP selling in the range of Rs 350-390/-. GFOP selling around last levels between Rs 350-400/-.  Larger Brokens selling at levels similar to last and selling in the range of Rs 270-330/-. Smaller brokens selling witnessing less competition and selling at irregularly lower rates, between Rs 250-290/-. FOP/OP and  Bolder Brokens (BPS/BOP) continue to garner strong support. Nominal quantity of Fannings selling around last levels. Secondaries firm around last levels.
BUYING PATTERN:
Middle East : Active
CIS:  Good Support
KOLKATA SALE  DUST MARKET
MARKET REPORT:
All sorts firm to dearer.
BUYING PATTERN:
HUL: Mainstay
Western India: Active
Local/internal: Operating
Courtesy - J Thomas & Company Private Limited
JAKARTA AUCTION
SALE OF - 21ST APRIL 2025 (SALE NO.16)
CTC LEAF
DEMAND: - Good General Demand.
MARKET: - The total CTC leaf teas sold this week was 90.45 (994,024.45kgs) of the total offering of 1,092,943.31Kgs.
BEST:- Best liquoring teas continues to sell at irregular levels closely following quality, however fanning grade this week met with some reduced demand from up country buyers. Local and Regional packagers continued to be fairly active.
GOOD:- All sorts in this category saw a slight reduced demand and prices were irregular and easier by Rs 2 to 4, there were no fanning grade on offer in this category this week. Regional packagers, upcountry buyers were selective along with some local buyers.
BETTER MEDIUM & MEDIUM:- Prices for all categories sold at at barely steady to easier levels, however the prices difference between the better medium and medium teas continues to be very narrow or sometimes the medium teas are fetching prices higher than the better medium teas. Major blenders were fairly active compared to last week. Western India regional Packateers were fairly active along with select buying from the upcountry and local buyers. Exporters continued to be fairly active.
PLAINERS:- Good demand but with prices declining by a couple of rupees. Exporters were active on the larger and select medium broken. Major blenders were very choosy and internal buyers were fairly active along with the upcountry buyers.
BUYING PATTERN: - The major blenders off take was 42.96% of the total CTC leaf sold.
ORTHODOX LEAF
DEMAND: - Good demand at last levels.
MARKET: - All categories of teas met with good demand with prices ruling at firm to occasionally dearer price levels especially on the top end high grown grades.Others were fully firm. Fanning sold at irregular levels following quality.
BUYING PATTERN: - Exporters & up country buyers continued to be active.
CTC DUST
DEMAND: - Good demand initially but started depleting as the sale progressed.
MARKET: - CTC dust offer this week was at 393,049.15Kgs of which 330,418.15kgs were sold (84.07%). Best & good teas continue sold at irregular prices following quality and competition. Better medium dust ruled firm to dearer prices especially on the finer dust. Medium and plainer teas sold barely steady to easier with teas facing withdrawals as the sale progressed.
BUYING PATTERN: - Major blenders were selective. Regional and local packeteers continued to be active on the best category teas. Up country and the local buyers were selective. Exporters were selective on the finer dust of the medium and plainer category but were active on the bolder dust especially on cleaner and blacker sorts.
ORTHODOX DUST
DEMAND: - Good but selective demand.
MARKET: - Primary dusts sold at irregular levels but few invoices faced withdrawals due to selective buying from the up country buyers. Secondary teas sold at barely steady levels.
BUYING PATTERN: - Regional & local packateers were selective and price sensitive on primary dusts. Exporters were selective on the secondary dusts.
Courtesy - J.Thomas & Co. Pvt. Ltd.
